entry.title: Calathea White Star
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en Ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 22.99

Perhaps one of the most elegant yet relatively muted designs on a Calathea is that of the Calathea majestica ‘White star’ (goeppertia majestica). Its contrasting white and green foliage with violet undersides and subtle pink blush make a style statement.

  • Shape and size may vary from photo
  • Shipped in a 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots
  • Free delivery across Canada with a minimum purchase of $95

 Keep moist but well drained. Water every 1-2 weeks.
 Rarely
 Non-toxic
 Growth : Up to 60 cm
 Origin : Brazil, South and Central America

entry.title: Sansevieria Cylindrica (Snake Plant) 4''
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 14.95

Sansevieria, also known as snake plants, are among the most popular and robust of house plants. They are especially sought after for their air purifying qualities.

Sansevieria can tolerate extremely dry temperatures and a variety from lighting conditions from quite bright to very low light. They are slow growing and sculptural, making perfect office plants. 

  • Shape and size may vary from the photo
  • Our plants are shipped in a 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots
  • Free delivery across Canada with a minimum purchase of $95
 Low light to bright indirect light
 Water thoroughly when soil is completely dry
 Rarely
 Toxic to animals
 Growth: Upright, 3 ft
 Origin : Tropical Africa
 Grown in Canada

entry.title: Sansevieria Whale Fin 4"
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 25.99

Whale Fin Sansevieria succulents are quite unique-looking and make great statement pieces for indoor gardening. As the name suggests, the plant is shaped curiously like a whale fin, stiff, erect and large. The Whale Fin is highly prized by plant enthusiasts for its unique shape and variegated foliage. 

Sansevieria can tolerate extremely dry temperatures and a variety from lighting conditions from quite bright to very low light. They are slow growing and sculptural, making perfect office plants.

entry.title: Crassula x Marchandii
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant

Crassula marchandi, or Crassula x marchandi, is best known to be a beautiful looking succulent. As the plant matures you can expect it to reach up to 12 cm (5″) tall. It has shiny leaves that are usually a deep green to dark maroon in color. It blooms tiny green flowers. They are relatively low maintenance.

Euphorbia pseudoglobosa is a dwarf spineless succulent that looks like a cactus, eventually forming a subterranean caudex. It forms thick mats of dwarf spineless segmented stems up to 20 cm in diameter. Euphorbia are generally easy to care for.

entry.title: Chlorophytum comosum Bonnie
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en Ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 9.99

Also known as Curly Spider Plant, Bonnie is one of the most popular air-purifying indoor house plants. It has classic green and white stripe variegation with uniquely attractive leaves that curl and swirl. Blooming stalks are yellow and often produce sprays of small white blooms. According to a NASA clean air study, Curly Spider Plant can filter formaldehyde, xylene, and toluene from the air.

  • Shape and size may vary from the photo
  • Shipped in a 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots
  • Free delivery across Canada with a minimum purchase of $95
 Low light to bright indirect light
 Allow top of soil to dry before watering
 Small white
 Non toxic
 Growth: Up to 60cm
 Origin : Tropical Africa
 Grown in Canada

entry.title: Austrocylindropuntia subulata f. cristate
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 14.99

Formerly referred to as Opuntia subulata cristata, its common name is Crested Eve's Needle. This cactus is a crested form of Eve's Needle where the stems fan outward into different wavy shapes topped with combs of long emerald green succulent leaves. This form does not bloom. They are slow-growing and can reach up to 1-2 feet tall.

  • Shape and size may vary from the photo
  • Shipped in a 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots

Vendor: Cactus en ligne

Agave victoriae-reginae, the Queen Victoria agave or royal agave, is a small species. This agave is highly variable in form, but in general the rosettes are small and compact, growing to 0.5m. They are composed of short, rigid, thick leaves that are green with a pattern of distinctive white markings.

entry.title: Agave Americana 4''
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 9.99

There are over 200 species of Agave found across the Americas. These plants can grow to huge sizes in their natural habitats, living for many decades and flowering only once before dying. But as they grow fairly slowly, they make perfectly sized indoor plants. Agave prefer hot, dry conditions with very little water or care needed. 

  • Shape and size may vary from the photo
  • Shipped in a 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots
  • Free delivery across Canada with a minimum purchase of $95

Myrtillocactus Geometrizans Fukurokuryuzinboku is a rare and monstrous form of Myrtillocactus Geometrizans. The stem is a bluish-green, growing up to 10 cm in diameter. It has unusual ribs shaped like a woman's breasts - hence its nickname "breast cactus".
